none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on November 07, 2017 Description from Terminal Escape:
I heard about this band a lot when I first moved to San Francisco. Maybe I just heard their name mentioned or read it in ads and it stuck with me, or maybe the handful of friends I had from the (far) East Bay were some imagined connection to Pleasanton's TRIBAL DISCO NOISE. I had always assumed that they were  a tribal, dance-inducing industrial outfit and I baselessly associated them with bands like CRASH WORSHIP and ¡TCHKUNG! even though I never saw or even heard the band. And then, years later (last year, in fact) Craig gifted be a pile of Bay Area tapes and I was happy to see this artifact in the pile. And then I pressed play....let's just say that 1992 was complicated, folks. TRIBAL DISCO NOISE
https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-nAxpCOm23Uo/WgMcqAEwIhI/AAAAAAAAR8I/QY-NZpcPE0MOvDyXQ-pVD160y_bh2CGfgCLcBGAs/s1600/TD%2BNoise%2Bdemo%2Bcover.jpg

seo.title: Tribal Disco Noise - demo '92 - Terminal Escape
